1604066073_mirrored_krixano_github.body: Currently, the best solution for sites not dependent on JavaScript is to set a theme-color and icon in meta tags and accessed through raw/ prefix, for Chrome. With iOS devices you also need content="yes" meta tag. I've looked into creating a manifest.json and adding lines to content.json to apply in the regular view (no raw/ prefix), but I hadn't gotten them to work for such a purpose. These are needed for app-like presentation and treatment by browsers. An API that applies similar properties for multiple browsers would be nice, like theme colors, background colors for splash screens, full screen or standalone, screen orientation, icons, etc. Most important though is providing prerequisites for sites requiring JavaScript, which, I'll repeat, I have no idea how to set. Even the smallest support or wisdom here would be great, because opening ZeroMe or KopyKate from home/desktop/taskbar shortcuts in full screen would be nice. A service worker isn't a requirement for that.
Krixano, what about this? Add a shortcut. On Android at the very least, it opens in full screen. Not a PWA, but just a WA: http://127.0.0.1:43110/raw/4Kave.bit/
(not Progressive) Web Apps don't need service workers.

I'm calm, not being arrogant, just showing you what I learned, and it's valid for what you and I wanted. We just need to figure out how this can work outside /raw. In general, meta tags don't work when we'd want them to. Content.json needs equivalent strings or ZeroNet needs to read meta tags always.

Showing you up is never my goal. I see what sometimes works and hope Nofish can make it always work. I'm seeking his wisdom, not questioning yours, such as anything I can use now. The last sentence of my first comment was hoping for wisdom from Nofish.

> 0 * * * * /home/user/sign_publish.sh >> /home/user/sign_publish.log 2>&1
> ```
> 
> where sign_publish.sh:
> 
> ```
> cd /home/user/ZeroNet
> bash ZeroNet.sh siteSign 1anysite --publish
> ```

I've gone through this with Mg0. Maybe I should change distros? We've not figured out the source of the problem.

1604068026_mirrored_styromaniac_github.body: @HelloZeroNet , this is not one that was reported before.

1604068034_mirrored_styromaniac_github.body: A code editor would be neat! Beaker Browser has such an app and it's very convenient.
Can this file editor prevent a noob from messing up their files?

1604068067_mirrored_styromaniac_github.body:
> OTOH http://127.0.0.1:43110/syncronite.zn doesn't work without the plugin as well.

Have you opened an issue?

I'm not sure you understand the issue here.

1604068084_mirrored_styromaniac_github.body:
> Do you want a button that says 'whenever I visit site A, redirect me to the same page on site B'?

Yes.

> That sounds strange. How you click on a forwarding link to site B if you don't have site A?
> It would be better to link directly the mobile version.

I'm not requiring that you don't download both merger sites, just saying that if there was a way to avoid downloading the deferred one(s), that would be nice.

I chose a bad example for a merger site. IFS Mobile is actually very popular, so there's no shortage of those links. A more fitting example is ZeroMe Luna vs. ZeroMe. Not everyone uses ZeroMe Luna, so they don't always share links to it, a site that I of course prefer (I am the owner). I want ZeroMe links converted to ZeroMe Luna links. Likewise, some might prefer ZeroMe over ZeroMe Luna.

Selecting a default merger site should also make that site the one that populates the newsfeed.

1604068113_mirrored_styromaniac_github.body:
> @styromaniac take a look at https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/pull/2657/files#diff-7e8d4a72fd3f5dfb486ac0bd395fe33d2ba5d32336079c79bba4d7062650e9ee 

Okay. I looked at it.

> @styromaniac and? It works? 

Oh. I didn't test it. Only my phone can connect to the internet right now, anyway, and I'm using ZeroNet Mobile.

> I'm pretty sure it works.
> 
> @imachug the android application has an "**Offers in-app purchases**" on Google Play which is a bad sign.
> @styromaniac I'm not recommending using the android application.
> 
> The applications logo is based on the logo of the Electrum bitcoin wallet, **I strongly recommend to remove the ZeroNet Mobile** if you have Electrum installed and you have bitcoin in that wallet.

I don't have any BTC.

1604068117_mirrored_styromaniac_github.body:
> Are you sure it works because of .htaccess, not because of ZeroNet core? What happens if you just delete .htaccess?

WebM videos would no longer open in the browser without JS and video elements.

For ZeroNet, a name before .htaccess is needed so it's not hidden. Mine is Kave.htaccess

> @styromaniac are you kidding me right? 
> 
> Here is your video player: 
> 
> ```
> <video controls poster="theimage.png">
>   <source src="thevideo.webm" type="video/webm">
>   <source src="thesamevideo.mp4" type="video/mp4">
>   <track label="Russian" kind="subtitles" srclang="en" src="thesubtitle.vtt" default>
> </video>
> ```
> 
> If you need professional web development you may consider hire a web developer! **.htaccess has nothing to do with ZeroNet because your Zeronet data folder is not located under /var/www!** 

I could swear it was the reason that WebM would play in the browser instead of download.

I prefer writing less code if possible, in part because I want people who might clone the site to have some shortcuts to desired results. I have a lightbox if you don't mind JS, and htaccess if you do mind JS. No need for the video tag. Everything works, just use an anchor tag around an image tag.

Also, numerous video players on a page is bad. I've heard enough complaints to shift away from having multiple video players embedded.

No need to be rude about it, and I've known about the video tag ever since 2010.

I'll close this issue and see if the lack of htaccess is going to work the same as with htaccess these days.

topic.title: Hashes instead of site addresses on blacklists
topic.body:
To provide absolute legal immunity, allow blocklist admins to use checksums of site public key strings instead of unhashed public key strings, and have ZeroNet hash the public keys of seeded and clicked site's public keys to check against blocklists' hashes. This kind of thing had its day in court before and gladly the ruling wasn't against the favor of those who have hyperlinks to illegal content, but someday, somewhere, that could change, and that is reason enough to provide such a feature.

The idea is that with this option, site addresses are forward hashed so they aren't retrievable, reversible nor useful to visit offending sites any longer.

topic.title: Storage permission might be unnecessary for ZeroNet-Kivy
topic.body: ZeroNet is working fine for me without it enabled, and I've never noticed a problem with it disabled. Multiple times I've enabled it, but never noticing a need to. Now, I've been using ZeroNet with it disabled ever since the IPv6 pull request, because I reinstalled it since then. The permission is likely for accessing files outside ZeroNet's directory, not for accessing ZeroNet's directory.

topic.title: On Android, Clicking "Show data directory" crashes ZeroNet
topic.body: In case it's specific to ZeroNet-Kivy and doesn't belong here, yes, that's how I'm running ZeroNet.

topic.title: Community Themes
topic.body:
I would have fun creating themes for sites if this were made easy to understand what affects what like a live editor, without the possibility of losing changes if themes are switched or sites update. Users don't have to even trust me with a file I could change from my own site, but just copy CSS code they can preview by reading first, paste into an input box with a live preview, give it a name, and apply changes, being able to switch themes from ZeroHello. Allow the user to set a fallback theme if some sites don't have a theme under the name of the preferred theme. Something like that, anyway. It doesn't have to be exactly that way, but it's a draft idea.

I'm thinking a site just for sharing, searching and favoriting themes might be neat too. Think of it like how you can already do this for Firefox, but for individual sites.

topic.title: ZeroFrame API doesn't work with hyperlinks in web app
topic.body:
Open the site App 0
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1E7wdLyfWBZAJoPtk7t7dxBAdVFDkWpKrX/

Follow its instructions

While browsing ZeroNet in the web app (Chrome should be in a standalone app presentation), go to ThunderWave from there.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/thunderwave.bit/

All hyperlinks shared there, relative and absolute paths, return a null address no matter which browser is selected to open them.
>http://127.0.0.1:43110/thunderwave.bit/null
>Not Found
>null

Glightstar AKA AnthyG thinks it has to do with ZeroFrame API and needs to be reported here.

Whenever SSL arrives so that PWAs can be made, I believe this bug would have to be resolved too.

topic.title: Own Content Doesn't Always Sync Between Own Nodes With Same Account Logged In
topic.body:
This is still an ongoing problem where if you comment on a site from one device, in some cases, that comment doesn't sync with another device where your using the same account on the same site.

Example: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1542892944_1HiF6gUThBQQqghUPLxc7h2uupMJxwGbzj

topic.title: Blocklists don't block raw/ URLs
topic.body:
Instead it asks:
>ADD NEW SITE

topic.title: A Port Scanner and Automatic Open Port Selection Mode Built Into ZeroNet Would Be A Life Saver
topic.body:
It's becoming my go-to thing to scan for ports for ZeroNet to use, and port scanners have gotten me where I needed to experience ZeroNet at full speed.

This would be a good thing to put before new users to try instead of digging into router settings, especially when some routers aren't that functional (UPNP doesn't work on the PoS modem/router combo I'm renting even though it's a listed feature) or they don't have admin privileges to make changes there, plus going into router settings is only excessive work if there's already a TCP port open. Port scanners remove a lot of steps and trouble.

"So why not just stick with port scanner apps?"

That's not the point. This is something that probably only I had discovered out of ZeroNet's entire population, and better than making a post on ZeroTalk that would get buried is to present this as a native feature to ZeroNet, and selecting the port automatically if the user prefers.

It's as important as the UPNP port puncher.

topic.body:
This is absolutely the lightbox of my dreams right here:

https://sorgalla.com/lity/

Anything this beautiful... I think would fit into the heart of ZeroNet the way those other included libraries do.

topic.title: Consistent Old Bug: Opening Sidebar crashes ZeroNet
topic.body:
I made sure that over many months of seeing this that this is in fact the problem. I think the Geolite City Database has to do with it.

Using Android (ZeroNet-Kivy)

topic.title: Assume these values if content.json in site's root folder doesn't state otherwise
topic.body:
"viewport": "width=device-width, initial-scale=0.8",

This is important for responsive design on mobile phones. You'll also have the same size 0 button on all sites that don't state otherwise.

It will magically fix all sites to look as good on mobile as on desktop.

The problem is that without this, a bunch of sites have a shrunk 0 button and grown site elements in portrait. It becomes obnoxious and atrocious.

This is absolutely essential and necessary.

I'm tired of telling every site author how to fix their site so it displays properly on mobile, with no guarantee they will get around to it, if they're even still around or alive.

topic.title: Disable pull to refresh on all sites.
zn.amorgan.xyz never connects to my node
topic.body:
Both are on Py2 branch. ZeroNet-Kivy here, as usual.

Somehow there's a fragmentation here. It doesn't matter which ISP I use. T-Mobile has open ports, so no problem with ports while outdoors, yet this issue I report persists either way. I see no problem with trackers. The proxy produces errors trying to download updated optional index.html files from Kave. My new optional files don't download to the proxy from Kave nor KopyKate BIG Official. Storage space remaining are plenty on both.

>DATA/BLENDERMOVIES/INDEX.HTML DOWNLOAD FAILED

Proxy: rev3863, Tor Available
Mine: rev3866, Tor Disabled

Until other peers download these optional files, the proxy won't be retrieving them.

0net.io is also struggling. 0net.eu.org too.

Are all these proxies in Europe?! None are connecting to my node.

Not a single working proxy connects. I've tried them all.

topic.title: https trackers unsupported? Can this be changed?
topic.body: I don't see ZeroNet connecting to https trackers. Why not?

topic.title: Support for multiple tracker files
Support WebTorrent trackers
topic.body:
They start with wss:// or ws://

They support TCP, which to my knowledge Tor requires.

topic.title: ZeroNet doesn't reconnect to trackers after a few minutes of internet disconnection.
topic.body:
My cell service is suspended at the moment and as a result I see ZeroNet only connects to two trackers at most after at least a few minutes without internet connectivity. Sometimes it's no trackers. Restarting ZeroNet is required to resolve it. I think the tracker rating algorithm doesn't take into account temporary internet service interruption.

How it rates trackers should be done in comparison to other trackers or... if none work, don't rate them poorly. One and/or the other would prevent this bug if I understand how ZeroNet handles trackers.

topic.title: Not resetting the trackers files field prevents additional trackers in a new name file from being reached
topic.body: All right there in the title. Users wouldn't know to click that dot to reset instead of overwriting the path to the desired trackers file.

topic.title: Disallow initial-scale above 1.0
topic.body:
Or make the 0 button and side menu constant in size despite initial-scale

Or else sites can make the 0 button go off-screen, and I'm sure that's not intended.

topic.body:
I was able to install the example plugin and restart the proxy here:

https://awesome-zeronet.herokuapp.com/12pPwpQ3wSoEtvN549ZVGUpj3HejtBrX3k/

Permission isn't denied.

Syncronite is a site of mine solely for updating a list of quality BitTorrent trackers.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/15CEFKBRHFfAP9rmL6hhLmHoXrrgmw4B5o/

topic.title: Make album art, artist and song name appear in browser's notification tray music player
topic.body:
I don't know what I can do to make an album art, artist and song name appear in the notification tray for browsers. Without setting the target for MP3 files, you get "ZeroNet," the site's favicon, URL and name. I took a screenshot to show what I mean:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd/1573438368

Is there no other way to do this than to create one site per album with the site name and favicon being of the album?

I won't mind if the site name is still included in there somewhere, but I want the song metadata first and foremost to be displayed in the notification.

topic.title: Allow  "domain-name-yo": "", in content.json, ignored by clients without the plugin.
topic.body:
Unless Android gets the Py3 branch soon, I think there should be a line that the Py2 branch and non-users of the Name.yo plugin can ignore.

So if I add
> "domain-name-yo": "Syncronite.yo",

to the site's content.json, then users of the plugin can rejoice and those without the plugin can still navigate from ZeroHello to the site without error.

topic.title: Show alerts in title text.
topic.body: Such as a refresh 🔄 emoji at the beginning of the title when a new version of the page is available, so tabs can signal for site updates. Give simple emoji signals for each alert,

topic.title: Setting a port number below 1024
topic.body:
It prevents ZeroNet from working.

You have to change the port number under ZeroNet.conf back to one that's above 1023 to make ZeroNet work again.

topic.title: Starting ZeroNet fresh forces you to make a ZeroMe profile even if you have one already.
topic.body:
I don't know why I can't avoid having to create a new profile. I download the hubs after ZeroMe to prevent such a thing, but it no longer works. I'm still forced to create a profile now.

This occurs on Android and Linux, py3, latest revision.

topic.title: HTTP server in a language besides Python
topic.body:
I've played with plenty of HTTP server applications on Android and Linux. They feel much faster than ZeroNet. Now that I've published a copy of the Bible with an htm file per chapter (which means many htm files), ZeroNet is slow as hell with this site.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Mjd9zn88kNX1QEkFaq2MrWeMthnR15Fga/

Is there by any chance an Apache server implementation in rust or another close to metal programming language that could be used?

topic.title: All but one tracker are still deferred even when it's the internet connection lost.
topic.body:
You know when I asked for ZeroNet to not down-rate/defer trackers when the internet connection is lost? Well, it's not working. It never worked.

I'm on the latest revision, but that's not even relevant since the solution you provided didn't ever solve the problem.

topic.title: What is the algorithm for forward-hashing site addresses on a blocklist?
topic.body:
I never got a hint at what it ended up being. I want to hash these addresses sooner than later.

Is it documented anywhere?

Also, you need to link to the documentation site on ZeroHello.

topic.title: Horrendous Performance Regression with "OWNED SITES"
topic.body:
This was the reason why The Eternal Word *was* slow on my devices, because of this: If I say this is my site, then the site will be slow.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Mjd9zn88kNX1QEkFaq2MrWeMthnR15Fga/

You might need to grab the package from its GitHub site to try.

https://github.com/PR0M3TH3AN/eternal-word

Whatever is doing this, I want it to be turned off or set to a much lower polling rate.

I can no longer update ZeroMe Luna now. This is the reason: The user is not informed on private key deletion, and it's not optional.

This isn't wise to assume the user would know the effect and to not provide a choice for or against that.

topic.body:
When watching a documentary, if I leave the apartment (internet disconnects), then I can't get ZeroNet to resume downloading the video unless I restart ZeroNet.

This is one of the biggest annoyances about ZeroNet.

topic.body:
I have an app to automatically update the trackers list for Syncronite. I want an optional feature to sign and publish automatically when a change to the file(s) is detected, so then I don't have to sign and publish manually.

This way, updates to the trackers list happen as soon as possible.

topic.title: ZeroNet doesn't warn of seeded sites SHA-256 summed on blocklist.
topic.body: I have the fake spammer blocklist seeded. This is on my blocklist (MOAB) via SHA-256 checksum. I'm not warned that I'm seeding the site.

topic.title: User is unable to proceed to site if address is SHA-256 summed on blocklist.
topic.body: Instead, the user has to go back and disable the blocklist, then revisit the blocked site's link. This is inconvenient.

topic.title: On Linux, a new file identical to the one it replaces counts as a change, but it shouldn't.
topic.body: I have cron setup on my laptop to download Ngosang's trackers list. I've had it set to every minute for testing purposes. Even when Ngosang's site says his list updated seven hours ago, every single minute ZeroNet thinks the file is updated again. This is a false positive.

topic.title: Deleting file server port number from the config page makes ZeroNet unable to run.
topic.body:
I thought this would randomize the file server port number, but it doesn't. Instead, the user has to edit zeronet.conf to have a specific port number to make ZeroNet work again.

Rev 4493 on Linux.

topic.title: If you ever use LibTorrent, Look into Tribler's TOR-like routing.

>Anonymity. Tribler offers anonymous downloading. ... We do NOT use the normal Tor network, but created a dedicated Tor-like onion routing network exclusively for torrent downloading.

https://www.tribler.org/

It's written in Python, BTW, so maybe you can easily port its routing system to ZeroNet.

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tribler

Edit: Nevermind. Apparently it's a broken mess.

topic.title: Document available features of htaccess?
topic.body:
I've never seen anyone else use htaccess on ZeroNet before. I know some features appear unavailable, but below works to stream WebM videos in the browser.

>\# This forces WebM videos to open in the browser while without the lightbox.
><FilesMatch "\.(?i:webm)$">
>    ForceType application/octet-stream
>    Header set Content-Disposition attachment
><\/FilesMatch>

And I'm wondering why entering multiple file types with | separating them doesn't work.
